result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin N Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Contrary to Injunction, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: *As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH, Huber privileges for work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin N Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $300.00 entered as ordered by the court on 02/23/16 to pay $100.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 07/01/16.  Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, filed and signed by the Court.

Defendant Justin N Thompson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH, Huber privileges for work.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given. 
- Received and filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Justin N Thompson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink. James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State's Demand for discovery and inspection, filed.
State's Motion in Limine, filed.
filed.

Final pre-trial conference held.   Case remains calendared for jury trial on January 6, 2016 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.

Defendant Justin N Thompson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court determines that defendant is eligible for counsel to be appointed at COUNTY expense.  Defendant is ordered to re-pay the County at the rate of $100.00 per month and is advised that failure to pay will result in the entry of a CIVIL JUDGMENT.  The court appointed ATTORNEY Daniel Meylink to represent the defendant.  Counsel accepts the appointment.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Justin N Thompson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case was transferred from another court.  The court ordered attorney Meylink to escort defendant to the public defender's office to see if he qualifies for representation.  If the defendant does qualify, attorney Meylink may be appointed through the pubic defender's office.  Case remains calendared for final pretrial on December 21, 2015 at 8:30 am and jury trial on January 6, 2016 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.

Hearing notices sent out week prior to today's date to reschedule dates previously calendared.   Defendant unable to get off work to attend today's proceedings.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.

for payment of attorney fees and costs, signed and filed. Order forwarded to the Clerk's office for processng. sab
State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine, and State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Justin N Thompson in court.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Defendant was previously appointed counsel, Attorney Obernberger, and due to medical conditions Attorney Obernberger is unable to continue to represent the Defendant. Court reviews the Defendant's finances for consideration of another court appointed attorney. Court allows the defendant time to contact five (5) law firms provide the court with documentation of those meetings.  Court will review the information and reconsider appointing counsel upon presentation of documentation received on private counsel. 
Case is adjourned for Status of Counsel to allow scheduling to take place in front of Judge McAdams on 12-17-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Parties are notified that effective December 1, 2014 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 7, in Room 629 of the Courthouse. 
Jury Trial scheduled for 12-3-2014 is cancelled.

  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Justin N Thompson in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Justin N Thompson in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation if released from custody.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
